title: There is an emotion where people literally turn into wild pigs.
excerpt:
Psychologist Averill (1980) described an emotion among the Gururumba people in New Guinea called “being a wild pig.”

Overwhelmed individuals steal small things, hide in the forest, and come back calm, as if nothing happened.
